document_data.name: Crypt of Badr Al-Mosak
document_data.mainbody: The '''Crypt of Badr Al-Mosak''' was an ancient tomb in [[Raurin]] that was repurposed as a stronghold by the [[efreet]] [[Khalitharius]] in the {{yearlinkName|1356}}, shortly after his release.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|80}}
document_data.Location: The Crypt of Badr Al-Mosak was about {{SI|50|mile|k|long=yes}} south by southwest of the [[Oasis of the White Palm]], across a formation of blasted hills. It was most accessible from the north.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|145}}
document_data.Defenses:
The statue itself was the focus of a permanent ''[[fear]]'' effect, whose strength was greater than normal; it had been placed by the efreet, and would break if the statue was moved.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|80}}

Amongst the monsters wandering the crypt were mummies, wights, wraiths, a spectre, [[giant rat]]s, a [[gorgon]], [[giant snake|giant cobras]], and [[giant spider]]s.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|80}}
document_data.Rumors & Legends: [[Barus Broadblade]], after being interrogated by the dervish cultists in the oasis, had come to believe (correctly) that the efreet had taken the princess to his stronghold in the Crypt.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|76}} [[Tolnus Granicus]], guildmaster of the [[Sandvoyagers' Guild]], had independently come to a similar conclusion.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|79}}
